snippet.textDisplay:
My anti-knock prototype let's me advance ignition timing to the maximum factory setting. This gives more time for engines to convert fuel into mechanical work.

Greater efficiency is the result.

Instructions on how to modify lawnmowers and generators are in the comment section of my video.

My lawnmower runs for about four hours on one tank of fuel. An electric lawnmower would have to charge four to five times to match this.
snippet.textOriginal:
My anti-knock prototype let's me advance ignition timing to the maximum factory setting.  This gives more time for engines to convert fuel into mechanical work.  

Greater efficiency is the result.  

Instructions on how to modify lawnmowers and generators are in the comment section of my video.

My lawnmower runs for about four hours on one tank of fuel.  An electric lawnmower would have to charge four to five times to match this.

snippet.textDisplay: some info.      [ these days, many people are too oblivious, to perceive their own  Low level  of intellectual function; hence, the torrent of stoopidity, seen below.    i do not  plan to read the letter.     so, i will offer general observations. ]            'nothing happens in a vacuum'.   this means that, a web of causality extends outward, from any action/event; actions Include, Speaking.    it also means that,  a so-called  'original' cause, is seldom, truly, original.     these truths  Should  lead one to,  comprehend the fact that it is possible for the  consequences of ones (every day) actions, to extend  Far beyond  oneself.      one should remain cognizant of the fact, at all times,  that the events of any moment in time, are a  'product'  of all that came  Before.   thus, rash, ill-considered, reflexive  action is  Seldom a good  first  choice.          as others have noted, this discussion of  carbon is  less-than  complete.      ultimately, the global climate is  Beyond  human control.    climate change is a fact; and it is upon us.      the time for debate and finger-pointing is  past.       humans have the technology to cope, with climate change.      and such issues are coming to the 'front burners'; around the world.     in addition, the same (old) issues are still with us:   safe/potable water, food, shelter, sanitation/pollution, aberrant/criminal mindsets, and lack of, or decaying, infrastructure.      one of the issues that continues to hobble human 'thinking' is the  toxic and all-pervasive,  profit motive.     today, the profit motive is  embedded in  the collective human psyche.  (in other words, ones  Fundamental beliefs are  'shaped'  by  this  wrongness, without conscious thought; at  Any  moment.)      one toxic result of this  embedded thought process is the, ghastly, idea of  a    'Cost  of  LIVING'. !          in the context of climate and environment,   humans should make it a high priority to  clean-up  the  oceans/seas.      this is a problem that does Not require 'higher math', to solve.      it is easy for  persons with 'deep pockets' to spout  ideas.     those same persons are the ones in the  best  positions  to  make  the  Most  difference.   and, results  speak  for  themselves!!!!       in the case of the gates foundation, however, research indicates that the policies governing  'access'  to foundation resources are, fully,  biased in favor of  'Organizations'; and, against  successful access, by the 'little guy'; the  Individual  inventor/innovator.    while this is not, in itself, unreasonable, it seriously  limits the  Foundation's  access  to   INNOVATION.    googletranslate

snippet.textDisplay:
Because of the way Casually Explained uses comedy, you sit through the last half waiting for some punchline or joke to be thrown in, while still being entertained because you know it's coming.


But this time it wasn't.


Now that's a punchline you can feel.
snippet.textOriginal:
Because of the way Casually Explained uses comedy, you sit through the last half waiting for some punchline or joke to be thrown in, while still being entertained because you know it's coming.


But this time it wasn't.


Now that's a punchline you can feel.

snippet.textDisplay:
There's a million reasons. To reduce fossil-fuel emissions The pollution to our environment Poisoning the air we breathe the land we grow our food. And live on and the water we drink. Are all perfectly valid reasons But CO2 isn't one of them.

Funny thing about CO2 Not only do plants absorb it. But in professional greenhouses, they increase the CO2 levels to double the natural level. Counting just terrestrial plants They absorb 25% of CO2 produced globally every year both naturally and man-made That isn't counting things like plankton. Not to mention those are rough estimates and it's been proven that there are a lot of species of plants that have increased their CO2 intake as the CO2 increases in the atmosphere.

To give a little perspective. CO2 represents 4% of all greenhouse gases natural and man-made Mankind's contribution to that Is 0.4% with all greenhouse gases both natural and man-made only making up 1% of the atmosphere.
Since terrestrial plant life absorbs 25% of the total annually produced CO2 globally That means 22.5. Times more CO2 is absorbed by plant life. Then is produced by mankind annually.

Current climate models are off so much at the moment because they don't include some very important variables. Thankfully some of these variables are going to be mandatorily included in the models by 2022. Including a few different types of solar forcing which are Paramount

Anyone that argues climate change doesn't exist Is an idiot. The only debate is whether or not it's man-made. If you go off of Old science, it seems pretty cut-and-dry that it is, but At the same time using that data has never produced a forecasting model that matches observations The climate is a unbelievably complex. Multifaceted thing and unless the vast majority of all major and minor variables are accounted for the math Can be checked double checked. Triple checked and sworn to be perfect. But in the end the answer will still be wrong.

As an example Say you're counting apples. In boxes in a room you only found four of those boxes.
1 + 3 + 7 + 9= 20 <- The math is correct. But you didn't find the other two boxes in the room. So the answer is wrong. the problem is missing the other two boxes, which would add + 6 + 4 Meaning the proper answer is 30. But to the person that didn't find those other two boxes they will argue. Their math is correct. And from their point of view their being honest. Even though they're still wrong.

The old climate models only count the Sun as having a 0.4% variance of UV irradiance. And count that as the only form of solar forcing on our climate Any solar physicists will tell you. The sun delivers much more energy to the Earth and has about a dozen different ways of doing so. It is the number one factor in our climate here on Earth. Some of those effects results instantly while it takes 30 years or more for others to resolve And when we gained the 0.5 Degree increase to average global temperatures that is climate change. The sun was going through its most active phase in recorded history We're feeling the effects from it even now. 30 years later

Just a reminder. We Are One stratospheric injection type volcanic eruption away from a 4 degree drop in average global temperatures That will last for a decade. And we are long overdue for this type of eruption.

The Beaufort gyre has become a cold climate bomb waiting to happen as it has not reversed and delivered its icy cold payload in almost 20 years. This is something that usually happens every couple of years. And helps to cool down the Atlantic.

They're expecting a solar minimum on par. With the maunder minimum to occur after solar cycle 25 it could be 26 or 27. But it's happening soon.

The climate has always and will always change. The amount of CO2 we would have to put into the atmosphere in order to even have a tiny impact. Is currently impossible For mankind Pre-industrial Revolution. We were actually reaching dangerously low CO2 levels for plant life on Earth.

snippet.textDisplay: Well, ok. But you (as in the general public) don’t want nuclear to produce the power needed for that, and it is the only viable solution regarding carbon emission. Solar panels are unviable and so are windmill. You could maybe get to 20% of the required energy production with them while not bankrupting your entire country, not even talking about developing countries, nor countries who don’t have the space to build them, or countries like France where the air force's bases prevent any windmill due to them taking too much space of the training areas and blocking radar transmissions. (and add the upkeep which isn’t free nor carbon free). So what do we do ? Stop pholosophying and state a real solution for once. (I already gave mine, nuclear. And people who are against it are either ignorant about nuclear power and how it works or completely incapable of making a moral choice between "two evils", even tho I don’t consider nuclear power to be an evil but whatever).

snippet.textDisplay:
How much carbon it takes to manufacture solar panels and wind turbines and how long do they last? Then you have to do the batteries for storage and cost of clearing land to place solar and wind. Not sure it’s any better than coal or natural gas. And you can see when countries switch to more green tech their co2 output ends up increasing because that have to start and stop the conventional power plants when wind and solar fall short (see Germany). You also see around a 20% increase in cost.

We have the answer it’s nuclear power but that one not on the table. I get why but until we invent more efficient green energy that’s our only option.
snippet.textOriginal:
How much carbon it takes to manufacture solar panels and wind turbines and how long do they last?  Then you have to do the batteries for storage and cost of clearing land to place solar and wind.  Not sure it’s any better than coal or natural gas.  And you can see when countries switch to more green tech their co2 output ends up increasing because that have to start and stop the conventional power plants when wind and solar fall short (see Germany). You also see around a 20% increase in cost.

We have the answer it’s nuclear power but that one not on the table.  I get why but until we invent more efficient green energy that’s our only option.

snippet.textDisplay:
Law of conservation of mass.
Carbon is inevitable.
To eliminate carbon would result in a barren planet.
No trees, plants, animals or humans.
In fact, of the estimated 40,000 metric tons of comic dust the earth gathers, a portion has to be carbon.

snippet.textDisplay:
Rich people make me paranoid when spreading their message of pollution. It's usually an undertone of: You should be ashamed of yourself, you should not exist and so on. Not the real issues of pollution, which are; poverty, careless corporations, governmental neglect and stuff like that. Most of the pollution in the world is caused by normal people, but because of lack of easy solutions.


Simply put: It is our governments' responsibility to provide solutions, because we're already PAYING for those solutions.

snippet.textDisplay:
I am neutral on this stuff. But logical: Lets go through a few lessons: (long read, but common sense).
1. Lets put up wind farms all over the place in big numbers. - Lets melt steel that costs thousands of dollars and burns up tons of electricity and strips the earth of mining materials to make them.

2. Lets mandate DOC, DPF and SCR filters on semi trucks. We manufacture DEF fluid, heavily stripmine the earth for trace minerals of PLATINUM and fast-idle trucks for 40 minutes burning FUEL to do a REGEN of the DPF. And NOW the truck gets 1.5mpg on climbing hills instead of 5.

3. Hydrogen engines are great and I will agree they work GOOD. But instead of auto companies offering retrofit programs. They want us to create MORE waste and greenhouse gases. Pushing us into BUYING ANOTHER vehicle that has to be MADE from more earth materials. - Any auto company can retrofit a motor for a vehicle. They just chose NOT to.
4. Lets use nasty paper straws that are CUT from trees and degrade when used. Plastic actually does not cut down trees.

5. Lets sort our recycle bins. - How about form groups to go sort LANDFILLS, where the problem EXISTS.

6. Lets talk about PUSHING for environmental activism. - Where's your solar panel on your house? A simple grid tie system costs 300 bucks and yet NOBODY does it.

7. lets NOT explore the option of more train transportation and only take airplanes that SPEW burnt fuel into the atmosphere at 30,000 plus feet in the air.

8. Lets mandate EPA changes and requirements for all citizens. - Citizens no longer can afford to pay bills and buy food. "but it is good for the environment"... "but there are homeless people whom are starving.. but.. it is.. GOOD for the environment. Yeah, just ask every person that cannot get a mortgage and/or afford their BILLS for clean and running water. Thank you EPA for making sewage processing and water meters expensive.

9. Our nations healthcare sucks.. nobody can afford to shower as often or wash their hands.

10. Our nations healthcare is really bad. Plastic IV bags, sterile medical tubes cost too much due to taxes on plastic..

--Did you enjoy this discussion? I sure did! If you were offended by ANY of these grammatical spelling errors. The internetz is NOT for u. meme life.

1. Lets put up wind farms all over the place in big numbers. - Lets melt steel that costs thousands of dollars and burns up tons of electricity and strips the earth of mining materials to make them.

Pushing us into BUYING ANOTHER vehicle that has to be MADE from more earth materials. - Any auto company can retrofit a motor for a vehicle. They just chose NOT to.

6. Lets talk about PUSHING for environmental activism. - Where's your solar panel on your house? A simple grid tie system costs 300 bucks and yet NOBODY does it.

snippet.textDisplay: I admire Bill Gates' commitment to cleaner energy sources, but he should focus more on improving the negative public opinion of nuclear power. I know he's a pro-nuclear guy, but it's really unpopular with people who supposedly care about the environment. This probably won't ever happen now that America is balls deep in that sweet sweet shale oil, but I would like to see large-scale efforts made to portray nuclear power in a more favorable light moving forward.
snippet.textOriginal: I admire Bill Gates' commitment to cleaner energy sources, but he should focus more on improving the negative public opinion of nuclear power. snippet.textDisplay: 100 companies are responsible for 77% of carbon emissions. Individual actions are fine, but I think--somewhat like what you said in the video--the problem can only be solved on collective level. China's electric buses are displacing more oil than all electric cars in the world combined. And they have 99% of the electric buses in the world and they put out more new ones than London has every week. China is running headlong toward solutions and we should copy them.
snippet.textOriginal: 100 companies are responsible for 77% of carbon emissions. Individual actions are fine, but I think--somewhat like what you said in the video--the problem can only be solved on collective level. snippet.textDisplay: One of the programs that Bill Gates is helping fund and which I believe has the best chance of reducing carbon emissions is the construction of 4th generation nuclear reactors. By using Thorium instead of Uranium and using a molten salt reactors, it is physically impossible for a nuclear meltdown to occur, while it would produce as much as 200x the energy a normal nuclear reactor can produce, all while producing zero carbon emissions. There's enough Thorium to power the entire world for almost 1000 years, and it can produce energy 24/7/365,  unlike solar power.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the programs that Bill Gates is helping fund and which I believe has the best chance of reducing carbon emissions is the construction of 4th generation nuclear reactors. By using Thorium instead of Uranium and using a molten salt reactors, it is physically impossible for a nuclear meltdown to occur, while it would produce as much as 200x the energy a normal nuclear reactor can produce, all while producing zero carbon emissions. There's enough Thorium to power the entire world for almost 1000 years, and it can produce energy 24/7/365,  unlike solar power.

snippet.textDisplay: Driving an electric car in a country with renewable electricity does not save the world. You then use up electricity that would have been sent off to another country where they use fossil fuel to make electricity. If renewable power is used on my tesla it simply means someone in another country/place will use fossil fuel to heat up their home.

You then use up electricity that would have been sent off to another country where they use fossil fuel to make electricity. If renewable power is used on my tesla it simply means someone in another country/place will use fossil fuel to heat up their home.
